title: Broly46
author: Broly46
content: The dark secret behind Elon Musk twitter purchase, he need to make himself “look” very busy, or ...some authority would come visit him and lecture him for having no work. As usual rich people like Elon Musk do not ever work hard in his entire life, he just leeching on whatever money he can get from his company, but his fear of getting visited get the best out of him. It’s hard to prove himself very busy, by using twitter he can make a lot of noise on the website and that can be used as a solid and powerful proof to show he is indeed very busy, as you know in the office politics lazy employee always make the loudest noise and steal every contribution he can get, most often lazy guy just using nerdy guy for his very own benefit, the nerdy guy work very hard while nerdy guy are absolutely unsociable, the lazy guy instead is very sociable and take full advantage of this phenomenal and use the nerdy guy and his hard work, include them into his resume and convince the boss that he is indeed worked hard for the company and deserve to be praised, the boss had no choice but to accept the falsified credits, in the end the nerdy guy loss the job due to his contribution got stolen, and frustrated by the office politics also boss do not recognise his hard work, all his hard work and time invested to the company go into veins; while the lazy guy got the best out of the deal and promoted into high rank executives and continue to steal from the inside by preying on the next new wageslave that’s freshly come out of the school who know nothing about dirty foul play on the office.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: He's kinda like the modern Thomas Edison, though at least he can explain in the simplest detail what they are doing, and the specifics of what they just did. Not a lot of credit-grabbers can do what Elon is doing, although of course that doesn't make it right in any way. That is why I laugh whenever people think that SpaceX reusable rocket is his own doing; he has a team of engineers who works day and night in R&D to make it a reality. He has the vision, but he surely does not have all the brainpower to achieve all of that. If he did, he wouldn't really need social media at all and would just continue doing what he does best behind the scenes, creating more and more inventions to make him and his company a lot of money.

comments.body: Elon Musk could've made enough "noise" without spending 44 billions dollars on buying a toxic social network(really overpriced).He owns Tesla and Spacex(and a bunch of shitty companies like "The Boring Company"). Can't he "make noise" there? Musk seems like a narcissist and an extrovert. He wants to be at the spotlight every day. This probably has something to do with your theory about "lazy people making the most noise and stealing ideas and credit from the hardworking people). I'm not a psychologist and I don't know how narcissistic extroverts behave in a work environment. I don't really think that Elon Musk is lazy. If he was lazy, he would never become the richest man in the world.He's a shareholder, this means that he isn't obligated to work in his companies. He could resign as a CEO and hire another guy as CEO.Musk is simply an "attention whore" and a troll. I don't like his sense of humor.

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: Rich guy stealing from the hard work of their workers is not really an argument. I mean it does happen, that's a fact, but what could be done about it? If you want to get rid of the rich, then how could we have this many workers? Like even if we forget about Elon, lets look at Jeff bezos, dude is making tens of billions off his thousands of workers, and yeah that's bad, I rather have more of that share go to workers, but in that case they just fire the least profitable ones and tens of thousands of jobs are gone.So you either let rich get rich off others hard work and we have tens of thousands of jobs, or you stop them and we do not have that unfair difference, but also lack tens of thousands of jobs. Which one do you want? Everyone wants a world where richest person in the world has a billion at most, and they spend the rest to either paying fair wages or hiring 100k+ more people but that just doesn't exist, it's not an option at all.
